intro: Ximenia americana var. argentinensis, commonly known as the Argentine ximenia, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, simple, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits. The fruits are typically split open to reveal a sticky, orange pulp containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in dry regions.
